Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, almost entirely flat, perhaps a lebes; glaze black misfired to red inside. Herakles to right (tail of lionskin, buttocks, thigh, leg of lionskin suspended preserved); to left, a border with palmette and lotus frieze. Added red for part of lionskin, the calyxes of the lotuses, and the hearts of the palmettes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 95 no. 331 pl. 71)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1993)
